title: How to write the main points especially when you are writing a summary - Quora

response.answer_text: Read the article to be summarized and be certain you understand it.You can first outline the article and note the major points.You an write a first draft of the summary without looking at the article.Start your summary with a clear recognition of the type of work, title, author, and main point in the present tense.Always exploit paraphrase when writing a summary. If you do copy a phrase from the original be definite it is a very important phrase that is necessary and cannot be paraphrased. In this case put "quotation marks" about the phrase. Summarizing is about extracting the main ideas, main points, and major support,and omitting the rest.When you summarize you do not sketch any original conclusions, but report facts as they are presented by the author, so that a reader unaware with the original gets from your summary the essential facts and point of view of the original selection.summarize is to concentrate a text to its major points and to do so in your own own words.This include every detail is neither necessary nor desirable. Instead, you must extract only those elements that you think are most important the main idea or thesis and its essential supporting points, which in the unique passage may have been interwoven with less important material. If you are one among such struggling students who need to complete the writing a summary assignment then you can go to any essay writing service from online.

A main point summary reads much like an article abstract, giving the most important "facts" of the text. It should identify the title, author, and main point or argument. When relevant, it can also include the text's source (book, essay, periodical, journal, etc.). As in all types of summary, a main point summary uses author tags, such as "In her article, Salahub states," or "Ms. Salahub argues/explains/says/asks/suggests." These tags will make it clear which ideas are those of the author and the text being summarized, not the summarizer. This type of summary might also use a quote from the text, but the quote should be representative of the text's main idea or point. A main point summary is often used when writing academic papers as a way to introduce the reader to a source and to place the main point of that source into the context of an argument or discussion of an issue.
